required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety of Sebryl® and Sebryl Plus® in Seborrheic Dermatitis and Psoriasis of Scalp
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Study to Evaluate the Safety of Sebryl® and / or Sebryl Plus® in the Treatment of Seborrheic Dermatitis and Psoriasis of the Scalp in Routine Medical Practice.

brief_summary.textblock: Observational, descriptive, retrospective, multicenter study to evaluate the safety of the treatment with Sebryl® and / or Sebryl Plus® in the management of seborrheic dermatitis and psoriasis of the scalp in routine medical practice.

detailed_description.textblock:
The objective of this study is to evaluate the frequency and intensity of adverse events presented during treatment with Sebryl® and / or Sebryl Plus® for the management of seborrheic dermatitis and psoriasis of the scalp. The sample will be at convenience. The files of the patients who have received treatment with Sebryl® and / or Sebryl Plus® in the last 5 years (2016 to 2021) will be chosen.
The researchers or the personnel designated by them will capture the information recorded by the treating physicians in the clinical file, sociodemographic, clinical and safety data that were presented after the prescription of Sebryl® and / or Sebryl Plus®.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the presence or absence of adverse events reported in the clinical files.
Classify reported adverse events according to seriousness, severity (intensity) and causality of the clinical manifestation
Describe the mean age in years of the patients included in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Describe study population by gender ratio
primary_outcome.description: Describe the proportion of women and men included in the study

primary_outcome.measure: Describe the body mass index through weight and heigh
primary_outcome.description: Describe the body mass index of the study population calculated through weight and heigh of the patient and using the formula kilogram over square meter.

primary_outcome.measure: Describe the blood pressure millimetres of mercury (mmHg)
primary_outcome.description: Describe the blood pressure in mmHg of the patients included in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean heart rate in beats per minute
primary_outcome.description: Describe the mean heart rate in beats per minute of the patients included in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of times use outside of expected indications
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of times Sebryl® and / or Sebryl® Plus were used outside of expected indications.

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of usage pattern according to prescribed dosage
secondary_outcome.description: Describe according to prescribed dosage the pattern of use of Sebryl® and / or Sebryl Plus® in the management of seborrheic dermatitis and psoriasis of the scalp.

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of usage pattern according to prescribed time
secondary_outcome.description: Describe according to prescribed time the pattern of use of Sebryl® and / or Sebryl Plus® in the management of seborrheic dermatitis and psoriasis of the scalp.

arm_group.description: Pharmaceutical Form: Shampoo Dosage: 0.2 g/ 5.0 g/ 3.0 g Administration way: For scalp use

arm_group.arm_group_label: A2: Allantoin/ Coal Tar/ Clioquinol/ Triclosan (Sebryl Plus®)
arm_group.description: Pharmaceutical Form: Shampoo Dosage: 0.2 g/ 3.0 g/ 3.0 g/ 0.3 g Administration way: For scalp use

intervention.description: Pharmaceutical Form: Shampoo Dosage: Allantoin 0.2 g/ Coal Tar 5.0 g/ Clioquinol 3.0 g Administration way: For scalp use
Pharmaceutical Form: Shampoo Dosage: Allantoin 0.2 g/ Coal Tar 3.0 g/ Clioquinol 3.0 g/ Triclosan 0.3 g. Administration way: For scalp us
intervention.arm_group_label: A2: Allantoin/ Coal Tar/ Clioquinol/ Triclosan (Sebryl Plus®)

study_pop.textblock: Subjects of indistinct sex with seborrheic dermatitis and / or psoriasis of the scalp who, according to medical criteria, have been candidates for treatment with Sebryl® and / or Sebryl Plus®.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any sex.
- Treatment with Sebryl® and / or Sebryl Plus® documented, for at least 2 consultations.
- That the patient has been questioned about possible adverse events
Exclusion Criteria:
- That the patient has used some other concomitant treatment for seborrheic dermatitis and psoriasis on the scalp.
